commit_message:
NSX: unify the two distributed routing extensions

This is done by adopting the router_extra_attributes
models. However, the NSX 'distributed' extension is
slightly different in that it is visible to tenants
and prevents router conversion (allow_put=false).

PUT requests are made return the correct HTTP code;
The access control misalignments will need to be
adjusted via rules in policy.json. This will be
properly documented.

DocImpact

Supports-blueprint: neutron-ovs-dvr

Change-Id: I35a4b54318d8169eb2c73be77ca2f30bbee08b46

commit_message:
virtualbox scripts translates "\r" in VM basepath

Prevents interpretation of backslashes in output of functions
get_vm_base_path(), get_vms_running(), get_vms_present() in
functions/vm.sh.

Closes-bug: #1334070
Change-Id: I74986537e3afbae05b146d2c8c2e2262684d308e

Change-Id: I09d8a71c9157bbbe5930c423a1feb71740e384c1
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Issue one SQL statement per execute() call

Some sqlalchemy drivers only support one SQL statement per execute()
call.  It isn't 100% clear from the sqlalchemy docs, but the sqlalchemy
author has confirmed that this is the intention.

Change-Id: I09d8a71c9157bbbe5930c423a1feb71740e384c1

commit_message:
Skip none value attributes for ec2 image bdm output.

Fix crash in _format_block_device_mapping when there are None values
for formatting attributes in the mapping.

Change-Id: I0ebdb844d75cdf1580cc88e1ff40fc21aff96f21
Closes-Bug: #1323403

commit_message:
Enhancing the make_test_data script

-Adding random boundaries rather than exact value for samples
-Allowing to pass datetime object or string
-Extracting make_test_data func, so it can be imported elsewhere
-Converting the integer time span to datetime

Change-Id: Iffbc8d9711b2f301a1f28b49980691ab34d17c20
Related-Bug: #1349791

commit_message:
Monitor Galera loss quorum condition

Pacemaker resource agent for Galera didn't detect 'Initialized' state.
This state happens when Galera lose quorum.

Change-Id: I3484e3c3c2d9c740d880ef73674b205c24402018
Closes-Bug: 1350545

commit_message:
Enable pc.ignore_quorum for Galera

- pc.ignore_quorum simplifies Galera quorum algorithm, allowing to
  loose 2/3 of 3 nodes.
- set O_DIRECT for innodb_flush

Change-Id: I1e4e3b11cfde6d768b9517bb5a564a9817059f39
Closes-Bug: 1350545

commit_message:
Fix docstring for scheduler_default_filters param

The docstring for the nova::scheduler::filter::scheduler_default_filters
paramater tells the user to specify it as a comma-separated string.
In actuality, the param is passed into stdlib's join() function, so
it's actually expecting an array.  This patch updates the documentation
accordingly.

Change-Id: Ib0b2757d4ddf0d9821aac8a1537e1338f69e1d69
Closes-bug: 1354477

commit_message:
Spec for stack lifecycle plugpoint

A cloud provider may have a need for custom code to examine stack requests
prior to performing the operations to create or update a stack.
Some providers may also need code to run after operations on
a stack complete. A mechanism is proposed whereby providers may easily add
pre-operation calls from heat to their own code, which is called prior to
performing the stack work, and post-operation calls, which are made after
a stack operation completes or fails.

blueprint stack-lifecycle-plugpoint

Change-Id: Ide4517f55267a1978ffffb264acd8a8128f38835

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-08-12 14:56:09.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/docker/files/supervisor/mcollective.conf', 'deployment/puppet/docker/templates/dhcrelay.conf.erb', 'deployment/puppet/docker/files/supervisor/ostf.conf', 'deployment/puppet/docker/files/supervisor/astute.conf', 'deployment/puppet/docker/files/supervisor/cobbler.conf', 'deployment/puppet/docker/files/supervisor/rsync.conf', 'deployment/puppet/docker/files/supervisor/nginx.conf', 'deployment/puppet/docker/files/supervisor/postgres.conf', 'deployment/puppet/docker/files/supervisor/rabbitmq.conf', 'deployment/puppet/docker/files/supervisor/nailgun.conf', 'deployment/puppet/docker/files/supervisor/rsyslog.conf'], 'message': 'Don't stop docker containers from supervisor

ATTENTION: this solution conflicts with
https://review.openstack.org/112077

- Use SIGTERM instead of SIGINT for dhcrelay_monitor supervisor
  service, because we have "sleep 30" loop in the monitor script,
  so it will handle SIGINT only when sleep ends.
- Send KILL instead of INT to "dockerctl attach" process to make
  sure we don't stop any container during supervisor shutdown or
  restart. This should make supervisor restart much faster and
  it's safe for upgrade process since we're not shutting down any
  containers. Supervisor only monitors them and brings them up,
  but does not stop them.

Change-Id: I08b50cf6f6ca7a93f446d07096ad25909ff60893
Related-bug: #1350764
(cherry picked from commit e3c30e50a99e143afcc705e258b9899a4151b9ff)
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Don't stop docker containers from supervisor

ATTENTION: this solution conflicts with
https://review.openstack.org/112077

- Use SIGTERM instead of SIGINT for dhcrelay_monitor supervisor
  service, because we have "sleep 30" loop in the monitor script,
  so it will handle SIGINT only when sleep ends.
- Send KILL instead of INT to "dockerctl attach" process to make
  sure we don't stop any container during supervisor shutdown or
  restart. This should make supervisor restart much faster and
  it's safe for upgrade process since we're not shutting down any
  containers. Supervisor only monitors them and brings them up,
  but does not stop them.

Change-Id: I08b50cf6f6ca7a93f446d07096ad25909ff60893
Related-bug: #1350764
(cherry picked from commit e3c30e50a99e143afcc705e258b9899a4151b9ff)

commit_message:
Change overcloud to use VIP for MySQL

This change sets applications to utilize the VIP address for database
connectivity and sets HAProxy in between the applications and MySQL.

Depends upon tripleo-image-elements changes:
    Ia6f26305f8e744e4ff938dff85de1193183ecd8f
    Iac1274cc52014f25887d696261b32146afc926dd
    I5af70abb96021146c098f788db349808d806a348

Related to blueprint tripleo-icehouse-ha-production-configuration

Change-Id: Ia9d6ed2771f756d2a97ae5df7ed737a062a59cf2

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-07-22 15:47:50.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Rename the "Identity" program to "TripleA"

TripleA refers to the combination of:

    Authentication + Authorization + Auditing

This name change is becoming more appropriate as the following trends
continue to develop:

1. Auditing becomes increasingly important to OpenStack operators.

2. Keystone works to further leverage external identity providers,
   making keystone itself a second class Identity provider.

In choosing a name/spelling, I followed the lead of TripleO's camel
casing, instead of using alternatives such as Triple-A or AAA.

This change also moves the PyCADF library to the TripleA program, which
provides OpenStack's auditing data model.

Change-Id: Ic911fdb11c79d55a5a9ef62c950c6eaa232c630c
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2014-07-23 15:37:20.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Rename the "Identity" program

continue to develop:

This change also moves the PyCADF library to the TripleA program, which
provides OpenStack's auditing data model.

Change-Id: Ic911fdb11c79d55a5a9ef62c950c6eaa232c630c
', 'number': 2}, {'created': '2014-07-25 17:39:44.000000000', 'files': ['reference/programs.yaml'], 'message': 'Rename the "Identity" program

continue to develop:

   the program's mission.

Change-Id: Ic911fdb11c79d55a5a9ef62c950c6eaa232c630c
', 'number': 3}]
commit_message:
Rename the "Identity" program

This name change is becoming more appropriate as the following trends
continue to develop:

1. Auditing becomes increasingly important to OpenStack operators and
   the program's mission.

2. Keystone works to further leverage external identity providers,
   making keystone itself a second class Identity provider.

Change-Id: Ic911fdb11c79d55a5a9ef62c950c6eaa232c630c

commit_message:
Move integration tests under mistralclient/tests folder

- Collect all tests in one folder 'mistralclient/tests'.
- Create new folder 'functional' in the mistralclient/tests for integration functional tests.
- Restructure tests, create folder 'v1' for current tests (version 1).
- Create new folder 'unit' in the mistralclient/tests and put all unit tests here.
- Correct imports in the file with unit tests.

Change-Id: If92c11640d7cb61ee8ffcdc7ba99d7ab1061afa7

commit_message:
Change Volume metadata attribute to raw dict.

Currently the volume metadata attribute is json
serialized, but outputting the raw dict is more
convenient for human users. This is fixed by
introducing a new attribute 'metadata_values'
whose output is in raw dict form. The attribte
'metadata' is preserved for those users who are
already used to its json serialized output.

Change-Id: Ib95656fa8632449957cd8c24b232f4d1b09a0e42
Closes-Bug: #1322007

commit_message:
Remove deprecated commands from shell

Remove all deprecated commands from the shell
since they are no longer used and to keep
the command line menu from looking cluttered.

Closes-bug: #1314218

Change-Id: I66e82872988e3835e4f290f48dfc80538271426c

commit_message:
Remove "--disabled" for firewall create rule

Allow "--enabled True/False" and remove "--disabled" for consistency across
all commands. Even in other neutron commands, we are using only --enabled
option but not --disabled. firewall-rule-show displays only "enabled" attribute
and there is no "disabled" attribute.

Change-Id: Ie591d827660466a774e431dcb40e04e09773e5f7
Closes-bug: 1327056

', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2014-07-21 15:15:52.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Allow form to stay modal after uploading file

Use JQuery Form Plugin for this purpose (placed in
horizon/static/horizon/lib/jquery). Browsers without XHR file upload
support (most importantly, IE<10) do not support setting custom AJAX
request headers, so form with File Upload field still loses modality
in them.

Change-Id: Id3b91a49a71c6de314c6a7cbee5357fe13679490
Closes-Bug: #1158501
', 'number': 2}, {'created': '2014-07-22 14:06:18.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Allow form to stay modal after uploading file

Use HTML5 FormData browser API together with FileList API to make
possible AJAX file uploads (see http://tinyurl.com/kmznw2n on FormData
examples). Feature detection is the same as in jQuery Form Plugin (see
http://tinyurl.com/n6v5dsx). Browsers without FormData support (most
importantly, IE<10) do not support setting custom AJAX request
headers, so form with File Upload field will lose modality in them
anyway.

Change-Id: Id3b91a49a71c6de314c6a7cbee5357fe13679490
Closes-Bug: #1158501

commit_message:
Allow form to stay modal after uploading file

Use HTML5 FormData browser API together with FileList API to make
possible AJAX file uploads (see http://tinyurl.com/kmznw2n on FormData
examples). Feature detection is the same as in jQuery Form Plugin (see
http://tinyurl.com/n6v5dsx). Browsers without FormData support (most
importantly, IE<10) do not support setting custom AJAX request
headers, so form with File Upload field will lose modality in them
anyway.

Change-Id: Id3b91a49a71c6de314c6a7cbee5357fe13679490
Closes-Bug: #1158501

commit_message:
Carrys the proxy variable while installing trove-integration

    Closes-Bug: 1322200

    Carrys the proxy variable (http_proxy/https_proxy/no_proxy) to sudo,
    while installing trove-integration. Fixing the Bug 1322200

Change-Id: I811586fb55919744fb87a1e735a6091a0142c91c

commit_message:
WIP: Port v2 volumes extension into v2.1

This patch port v2 volumes extension into v2.1, and try to share
volume attachment code between v2.1 and v3.

* move volumes and assisted volume snapshots into v2.1
* add block device mapping for v2.1
* translate block device mapping v2 for v2.1
* port the unittest

* TODO: input validation
* TODO: shared inittests with v2
* TODO: Find a way extend the translation mapping for
block_device_mapping_v2

Partially implements blueprint v2-on-v3-api

Change-Id: I88c3fa729b0b74f32313fd546c30389ce2c1d3e2

commit_message:
WIP: Distinguish different behavior between v2.1 and v3

This patch add a decorator to distinguish different version for same name
function. When invoke this kind of multiversion function, it will depend
on the api request version to decide which version of function will be invoked.

PoC target
 * get servers on the specified hypervisor:
    diff: Change API URL
             - '/os-hypervisors/[filters]/servers'
             + '/os-hypervisors/[hypervisor id]/servers'
          Rename attributes of response (uuid -> id)
    v3 patch: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/33775/4

 * search hypervisor on the specified hypervisor"
    diff: Change API URL
             - '/os-hypervisors/[filters]/search'
             + '/os-hypervisors/search?query=[filters]'
          Rename attributes of response (uuid -> id)
    v3 patch: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/33774/

Partially implements blueprint v2-on-v3-api

Change-Id: I44c208091004e88299d71820a389effe203709de

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-04-28 20:01:23.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "WIP register different action and resource name for v2.1 on v3

This patch use decorator or arguments on v3 code to register
different action and resource name for v2.1.

PoC Item:
resource name change: keypair -> os-keypair
action name change: migrate_live -> os_migrateLive

This is PoC patch.

Another approach is https://review.openstack.org/#/c/78906/ ,
That approach can handle more complex cases. It also provide
separated namespace for v2.1. It's easy to fake v2 extension structure.
For example, In v3 AdminActions extensions was split as multiple extensions,
It's easy to fake an v2's AdminActions on v3. The benefit is if the admin
want to disable AdminActions, admin only need specfic it in the extension
black list. And api user can query whether AdminActions is enabled by api.
But there is concern on the overhead.

Partially implements blueprint v2-on-v3-api

Change-Id: I8476885e6892632e2fdc4af6923d2d3f25aa1713

", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2014-04-28 20:01:23.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'WIP Register different action and resource name for v2.1 on v3

This patch adds an APIRouterV21 class and the api-paste code
required to implement a /v2.1/ REST API resource.

This patch uses a decorator to implement a different action
name for migrate live for V2.1 (keeping with V2) compared to
the V3 API.

The infrastructure is also added to supply an optional version
number to the Keypairs plugin get_resources method which allows
it to return a different resource name for V2.1 compared to V3.

Partially implements blueprint v2-on-v3-api

Change-Id: I8476885e6892632e2fdc4af6923d2d3f25aa1713

commit_message:
WIP Register different action and resource name for v2.1 on v3

This patch adds an APIRouterV21 class and the api-paste code
required to implement a /v2.1/ REST API resource.

This patch uses a decorator to implement a different action
name for migrate live for V2.1 (keeping with V2) compared to
the V3 API.

The infrastructure is also added to supply an optional version
number to the Keypairs plugin get_resources method which allows
it to return a different resource name for V2.1 compared to V3.

Partially implements blueprint v2-on-v3-api

Change-Id: I8476885e6892632e2fdc4af6923d2d3f25aa1713

commit_message:
Make Murano stats panel visible to admin only

In the absence of RBAC implementation, make the stats panel accessible
only to users with role 'admin', as with other horizon components.

Change-Id: I5231e682796d83625c4fbde294c7ad2289e1e55d
Implements: blueprint stats-panel-visible-to-admin-only

Allow resource to check whether it is in an expected state and update
status and action accordingly.

This first step only allows the base Resource class to perform a check
that will always fail with a NotSupported error.  This allows for the
other resources to implement their own checks for their expected states.

', 'number': 7}, {'created': '2014-06-19 20:55:04.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Check resources are in expected states

Allow resource to check whether it is in an expected state and update
status and action accordingly.

This adds a check action to the stack that will perform checks in all
their resources and nested resources as well.  If a resource doesn't
have a handle_check() method, check for that resource will just pass.

If any resource at the end of a Stack.check() doesn't have a
handle_check() method, then a message will be added to the status_reason
of both the resource and the stack saying that CHECK is not (fully)
supported.  This allows for the other resources to implement their own
checks for their expected states.

Co-Authored-By: Richard Lee <rblee88@gmail.com>
Implements: blueprint stack-check (partial)
Change-Id: I18985476696faeaa47149c233a067f9494c2effa

This adds a check action to the stack that will perform checks in all
their resources and nested resources as well.  If a resource doesn't
have a handle_check() method, check for that resource will just pass.

If any resource at the end of a Stack.check() doesn't have a
handle_check() method, then a message will be added to the status_reason
of both the resource and the stack saying that CHECK is not (fully)
supported.  This allows for the other resources to implement their own
checks for their expected states.

Co-Authored-By: Richard Lee <rblee88@gmail.com>
Implements: blueprint stack-check (partial)
Change-Id: I18985476696faeaa47149c233a067f9494c2effa

commit_message:
Check resources are in expected states

Allow resource to check whether it is in an expected state and update
status and action accordingly.

This adds a check action to the stack that will perform checks in all
their resources and nested resources as well.  If a resource doesn't
have a handle_check() method, check for that resource will just pass.

If any resource at the end of a Stack.check() doesn't have a
handle_check() method, then a message will be added to the status_reason
of both the resource and the stack saying that CHECK is not (fully)
supported.  This allows for the other resources to implement their own
checks for their expected states.

Co-Authored-By: Richard Lee <rblee88@gmail.com>
Implements: blueprint stack-check (partial)
Change-Id: I18985476696faeaa47149c233a067f9494c2effa

commit_message:
Optimize get_by_instance_uuid

Previously this method was issuing two requests: One filtering the node
by instance_uuid and another to get all the informations about that
node. This patch optimize it by using the /detail flag which will filter
the node by the instance_uuid and return all informations in one request.

Change-Id: Ia22c5012af12b131d5a6601653d704b5a9f39d82

commit_message:
Add __future__ import to register-nodes

register-nodes makes use of print, which means we should be explicit
and import print_function from __future__. This also makes futurize
happy with os-cloud-config.

Change-Id: I14523779a1f207fa389ddb59073cc9bfdda89386

commit_message:
HOT guide structure

This patch provides a structure for the HOT guide, without content. The
intent is to provide an overview of what needs to be documented.

The organization will probably change once we turn this book into a
chapter in the user guide.

Change-Id: I640c519e2c0d1f1b6ba974f37aa4cb2abcfd59c1
Implements: blueprint heat-templates

commit_message:
Fix manager.status_timeout exception

Method should not raise BuildErrorException, unless called specifically after
VM is created, to verify 'ACTIVE' state

Change-Id: I905ca17eeb9ec3767d1c1fb2ccc005b7c4d66c3b
Closes-Bug: #1335754

commit_message:
Use pacemaker for running ceilometer central agent

Ceilometer central agent can not be scaled out, only one instance
of central agent can run. Let pacemaker to manage central agent
in active/passive mode.

Relies on: I44909005d9bc653c3e7c2de1c12fe4ffecf6bede
Related to blueprint tripleo-icehouse-ha-production-configuration

Relies on: Icc97e36a1db198b973041346cf2056f68de661a2
Change-Id: Ifa83d62c2132bcdcb40d0b7c80ce3adadc0b5587

commit_message:
Update websocketproxy to work with websockify 0.6

Websockify version 0.6 bring with it several bugfixes and
new features that affect Nova (including a fix for
novncproxy zombies hanging around and better support for
the python logging framework). However, it also broke
backwards compatibility due to a refactor which brought
it inline with other Python socket server libraries.

This patch updates the websockify code to function with
websockify version 0.6 as well as websockify version 0.5.x.

This is a backport to Icehouse of:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/91663/.

Note that I currently already carry this patch as a Debian
specific patch.

Change-Id: I1cd8e202f5b0a3246128d173d415394caad3b058

subject: Fixing RBAC enforcer to validate tenant-id from uri
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 994, 'name': 'Arvind Tiwari', 'email': 'arvindt7@gmail.com', 'username': 'arvind-tiwari'}, {'_account_id': 1091, 'name': 'Arun Kant', 'email': 'arukant@cisco.com', 'username': 'arunkant-uws'}, {'_account_id': 7063, 'name': 'Robert Clark', 'email': 'hyakuhei@gmail.com', 'username': 'hyakuhei'}, {'_account_id': 7136, 'name': 'Chad Lung', 'email': 'chad.lung@gmail.com', 'username': 'chadlung'}, {'_account_id': 7789, 'name': 'John Wood', 'email': 'john.wood@rackspace.com', 'username': 'woodster'}, {'_account_id': 7874, 'name': 'Venkat Sundaram', 'email': 'tsv@hp.com', 'username': 'tsv'}, {'_account_id': 9234, 'name': 'Steve Heyman', 'email': 'steve@heyman.com', 'username': 'hockeynut'}, {'_account_id': 11860, 'name': 'Yang Li', 'email': 'yang.li14@hp.com', 'username': 'yangli'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-06-16 05:42:46.000000000', 'files': ['barbican/tests/api/test_resources_policy.py', 'barbican/api/controllers/__init__.py'], 'message': 'Fixing RBAC enforcer to validate tenant-id from uri

The RBAC enforcer decorator used by all of the resource
controllers ensures that the tenant-id passed in the
uri matches the tenant-id that the request token is
scoped to. However, the decorator that passes the
tenant-id (a.k.a keystone_id) to the enforcer looks
for the keystone_id in the kwargs parameter instead
of the args list. This results in a "None" value
always passed to the enforcer. The enforcer compares
the keystone_id only if it is not None. This effectively
bypasses the check! This fix gets the keystone_id from
the args list. It also removes the check in the enforcer
that bypasses the check if keystone_id is None.

The unit tests were also fixed. The mock request context
setup by the BaseTestCase class leaves the "tenant" field
as None and this resulted in not catching this error!
This fix sets a valid keystone_id to the tenant in the
context. New tests are added to check for the fail cases
where the tenant-id from uri doesn't match the one in the
auth context

Change-Id: I0b501f954dc3c56e8b500203cb1df8217bc95a17
Closes-Bug: #1330243
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fixing RBAC enforcer to validate tenant-id from uri

The RBAC enforcer decorator used by all of the resource
controllers ensures that the tenant-id passed in the
uri matches the tenant-id that the request token is
scoped to. However, the decorator that passes the
tenant-id (a.k.a keystone_id) to the enforcer looks
for the keystone_id in the kwargs parameter instead
of the args list. This results in a "None" value
always passed to the enforcer. The enforcer compares
the keystone_id only if it is not None. This effectively
bypasses the check! This fix gets the keystone_id from
the args list. It also removes the check in the enforcer
that bypasses the check if keystone_id is None.

The unit tests were also fixed. The mock request context
setup by the BaseTestCase class leaves the "tenant" field
as None and this resulted in not catching this error!
This fix sets a valid keystone_id to the tenant in the
context. New tests are added to check for the fail cases
where the tenant-id from uri doesn't match the one in the
auth context

Change-Id: I0b501f954dc3c56e8b500203cb1df8217bc95a17
Closes-Bug: #1330243

subject: Add visibility filter to datastore versions
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7092, 'name': 'Deprecated Trove CI', 'email': 'reddwarf-jenkins@googlegroups.com', 'username': 'reddwarf', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-07-29 03:34:43.000000000', 'files': ['tests/integration/int_tests.py'], 'message': "Add visibility filter to datastore versions

Allows datastore versions to be hidden from all users except those
explicitly allowed by their tenant. Implemented via a visibility
attribute for datastore versions (defaulting to 'public'), and a
datastore version member table for controlling access to non-public
datastore versions by tenant.

This commit pulls in the mgmt datastore integration tests and adds them
to the blackbox_mgmt group.

Implements: blueprint datastore-visibility
Change-Id: Ic8024a631530ba295688d7e49e895f50cb2f32ef
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Add visibility filter to datastore versions

Allows datastore versions to be hidden from all users except those
explicitly allowed by their tenant. Implemented via a visibility
attribute for datastore versions (defaulting to 'public'), and a
datastore version member table for controlling access to non-public
datastore versions by tenant.

This commit pulls in the mgmt datastore integration tests and adds them
to the blackbox_mgmt group.

Implements: blueprint datastore-visibility
Change-Id: Ic8024a631530ba295688d7e49e895f50cb2f32ef

commit_message:
Use common config generator

Delete Manila's implementation located in tools/conf and replace
it with common config generator located in tools/config. The new config
generator include config options from other modules (olso.messaging,
oslo.db, oslo.db.concurrency) which improves the generated sample config.

Change-Id: I553e1a8ec414383e2d79d445ebd10e0e1ffa1ae4

commit_message:
Add config module from oslo-incubator

Generated with: `./update.sh --module config --base manila
../../stackforge/manila/` from oslo-incubator, commit fed72f32.
This common code is expected to be used instead of Manila's
implementation located in 'tools/conf'.

Change-Id: I147888ba98ccb2ec98b9ced87b06d8f4766ec361

commit_message:
Implement BlockDeviceMappings for AWS::EC2::Instance

We should support the BlockDeviceMappings for
AWS::EC2::Instance resource to be compatible with
AWSCloudFormation.

Implements blueprint implement-ec2instance-bdm

Change-Id: Ib4d318b429494f312f4d6978631dd0a9721b32ee

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-02-28 10:06:22.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Simplify using external routers and metadata

The dhcp agent only pushes out the metadata
static route when the subnet is isolated, and it
determines that by checking if the gateway_ip is
not set. This makes it tricky to use external
routers and metadata from dhcp at the same time.

This patch changes how the dhcp agent determines
that the subnet is isolated. It now considers it
isolated if there is no Neutron router on it.
This makes it straightforward to use an external
router on a provider network and get the
metadata from the dhcp namespace.

Change-Id: I0e29a2f058564c267176dab26da00f6ef579808b
Closes-Bug: 1236783

commit_message:
Simplify using external routers and metadata

The dhcp agent only pushes out the metadata
static route when the subnet is isolated, and it
determines that by checking if the gateway_ip is
not set. This makes it tricky to use external
routers and metadata from dhcp at the same time.

This patch changes how the dhcp agent determines
that the subnet is isolated. It now considers it
isolated if there is no Neutron router on it.
This makes it straightforward to use an external
router on a provider network and get the
metadata from the dhcp namespace.

Change-Id: I0e29a2f058564c267176dab26da00f6ef579808b
Closes-Bug: 1236783
(cherry picked from c73b54e50b62c489f04432bdbc5bee678b18226e)

', 'number': 4}, {'created': '2014-02-26 03:14:23.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'This patch enables SR-IOV for networking, while keeping the existing PCI
passthrough functionality intact. Enhancements include:
 -- whitelist:
    A whitelist entry is defined as:
      ["device_id":"<id>",]["product_id":"<id>",]
      ["address":"[[[[<domain>]:]<bus>]:][<slot>][.[<function>]]",]
      {"<tag>":"tag-value",}
    . <id> can be a '*' or a valid device/product id as displayed by the
      linux utility lspci
    . the address uses the same syntax as it in lspci. refer to lspci's manual
      for its description about the '-s' switch. In addition, you can also use
      ethernet interface names that represent SR-IOV physical functions. If the
      address corresponds to a SR-IOV physical function, all the PCI devices
      with virtual functions under the phsical function will match the entry.
    . the tag can be any string. But for scheduling purpose, only the tag
      "physical_network" is supported in this patch

    Multiple whitelist entries per host are supported as they already are.
    "device_id", "product_id", and "address" are fields that will be matched
    against PCI devices that are returned as a result of querying libvirt.

 -- PCI stats:
    A stats group is keyed by either:
    . (device_id, provider_id, extra_info) that exists today. or
    . {"<tag>":"tag-value",} that is introduced in this patch

   If a whitelist entry contains one or more tags, and there are devices
   matching the entry, a PCI stats group that are keyed with the tags will
   be created. If a whitelist entry doesn't contain any tag, then the existing
   behavior applies, and one or more PCI stats groups may be created for
   devices matching the entry.

   a PCI device is matched against the PCI whitelist entries in the
   order as they are defined in the nova.conf file. Once a match is found,
   the device is placed in a PCI stats group that are keyed according to the
   above rule.

 -- existing PCI alias and its use in the nova server flavor remain as they
    are today.

 -- examples of defining whitelist entries:
    pci_passthrough_whitelist = {"address":"eth0", \
                                 "physical_network":"physnet"}
    pci_passthrough_whitelist = {"address":"*:0a:00.*",
                                 "physical_network":"physnet1"}
    pci_passthrough_whitelist = {"address":":0a:00.",
                                 "physical_network":"physnet1"}
    pci_passthrough_whitelist = {"vendor_id":"1137","product_id":"0071"}

 -- boot instances with PCI passthrough devices remains unchanged
    refer to https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Pci_passthrough

 -- boot instances with SR-IOV ports:
    . define each whitelist entry that is applicable to networking PCI
      devices so that it's tagged with the physical network name with
      which its matching devices are connected

    Use the following commands to boot instances
    . nova boot --flavor m1.large --image <image-uuid> \
       --nic net-id=<net-uuid>,vnic-type=<normal|direct|macvtap> vm
    . neutron port-create <net-uuid-or-name> \
       --binding:vnic-type <normal|direct|macvtap>
      nova boot --flavor m1.large --image <image-uuid> \
       --nic port-id=<port-uuid-from-above> vm

 -- boot instances with SR-IOV ports and other PCI passthrough devices.
    This can be done by following the above two boot procedures

Change-Id: I774d27b5f0cce858498d1d06bbd2a7ea1fa1b3c9
Implements: blueprint pci-passthrough-sriov

commit_message:
enables SR-IOV for networking

While keeping the existing PCI passthrough functionality intact, this patch
makes the following enhancements:
 -- whitelist:
    A whitelist entry is defined as:
      ["device_id":"<id>",]["product_id":"<id>",]
      ["address":"[[[[<domain>]:]<bus>]:][<slot>][.[<function>]]",]
      {"<tag>":"tag-value",}
    . <id> can be a '*' or a valid device/product id as displayed by the
      linux utility lspci
    . the address uses the same syntax as it in lspci. refer to lspci's manual
      for its description about the '-s' switch. In addition, you can also use
      ethernet interface names that represent SR-IOV physical functions. If the
      address corresponds to a SR-IOV physical function, all the PCI devices
      with virtual functions under the phsical function will match the entry.
    . the tag can be any string. But for scheduling purpose, only the tag
      "physical_network" is supported in this patch

    Multiple whitelist entries per host are supported as they already are.
    "device_id", "product_id", and "address" are fields that will be matched
    against PCI devices that are returned as a result of querying libvirt.

 -- PCI stats:
    A stats group is keyed by either:
    . (device_id, provider_id, extra_info) that exists today. or
    . {"<tag>":"tag-value",} that is introduced in this patch

   If a whitelist entry contains one or more tags, and there are devices
   matching the entry, a PCI stats group that are keyed with the tags will
   be created. If a whitelist entry doesn't contain any tag, then the existing
   behavior applies, and one or more PCI stats groups may be created for
   devices matching the entry.

   a PCI device is matched against the PCI whitelist entries in the
   order as they are defined in the nova.conf file. Once a match is found,
   the device is placed in a PCI stats group that are keyed according to the
   above rule.

 -- existing PCI alias and its use in the nova server flavor remain as they
    are today.

 -- examples of defining whitelist entries:
    pci_passthrough_whitelist = {"address":"eth0", \
                                 "physical_network":"physnet"}
    pci_passthrough_whitelist = {"address":"*:0a:00.*",
                                 "physical_network":"physnet1"}
    pci_passthrough_whitelist = {"address":":0a:00.",
                                 "physical_network":"physnet1"}
    pci_passthrough_whitelist = {"vendor_id":"1137","product_id":"0071"}

 -- boot instances with PCI passthrough devices remains unchanged
    refer to https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Pci_passthrough

 -- boot instances with SR-IOV ports:
    . define each whitelist entry that is applicable to networking PCI
      devices so that it's tagged with the physical network name with
      which its matching devices are connected

    Use the following commands to boot instances
    . nova boot --flavor m1.large --image <image-uuid> \
       --nic net-id=<net-uuid>,vnic-type=<normal|direct|macvtap> vm
    . neutron port-create <net-uuid-or-name> \
       --binding:vnic-type <normal|direct|macvtap>
      nova boot --flavor m1.large --image <image-uuid> \
       --nic port-id=<port-uuid-from-above> vm

 -- boot instances with SR-IOV ports and other PCI passthrough devices.
    This can be done by following the above two boot procedures

Change-Id: I774d27b5f0cce858498d1d06bbd2a7ea1fa1b3c9
Implements: blueprint pci-passthrough-sriov

commit_message:
Change value of None in encrypted volume field from "Maybe" to "-"

This makes it clearer to the user that information about whether the volume is
encrypted or not is not known.

Implemented by moving from standard yesno filter to filtering the value of the
encrypted field in the function get_encrypted_value

Change-Id: I14d157752e565fce68248af6c53a586ccf6c39be
Closes-Bug: 1354583

commit_message:
VMware: fix crash when VC driver boots

Commit 1deb31f85a8f5d1e261b2cf1eddc537a5da7f60b caused the driver to break.
This adds the missing method.

Change-Id: Iaf7e33a868724efdcb13fdd9ba1c74b92d2e6210
Closes-bug: #1355875

Remove config option pxe_bootfile_name & vestiges

anymore.  This change is source from
http://review.openstack.org/#/c/103167/7/nova/virt/ironic/driver.py

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-07-04 06:35:36.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Change unscoped token fallback to be session aware

The existing way of sending requests to the auth_url was to override the
management_url for the duration of a single call. Aside from being ugly,
this won't work with session objects where the management_url is
ignored.

Better align the legacy get_endpoint function with the behaviour on an
auth plugin such that if there is no management_url it should raise an
EndpointNotFound error rather than return None.

Allow passing kwargs through the base manager functions so that managers
can pass parameters down to the session.

Change-Id: I879adcb25dd373ab4a7b77b6539974e22220aad4

commit_message:
Change unscoped token fallback to be session aware

The existing way of sending requests to the auth_url was to override the
management_url for the duration of a single call. Aside from being ugly,
this won't work with session objects where the management_url is
ignored.

The tests for this behaviour have been previously merged to ensure that
the before and after behaviour remains unchanged.

Change-Id: I879adcb25dd373ab4a7b77b6539974e22220aad4

subject: Update 'list_users' call to use AGENT_HIGH_TIMEOUT
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 5293, 'name': 'Nikhil', 'email': 'SlickNik@gmail.com', 'username': 'slicknik'}, {'_account_id': 7092, 'name': 'Deprecated Trove CI', 'email': 'reddwarf-jenkins@googlegroups.com', 'username': 'reddwarf', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 8214, 'name': 'Auston McReynolds', 'email': 'amcreynolds@ebaysf.com', 'username': 'amcreynolds'}, {'_account_id': 8415, 'name': 'Denis M.', 'email': 'lildee1991@gmail.com', 'username': 'dmakogon'}, {'_account_id': 9664, 'name': 'amrith', 'email': 'amrith.kumar@gmail.com', 'username': 'amrith'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-08-12 23:01:34.000000000', 'files': ['trove/guestagent/api.py'], 'message': "Update 'list_users' call to use AGENT_HIGH_TIMEOUT

The list_users call in the guestagent takes about 0.4s - 0.5s per
user, and currently uses the AGENT_LOW_TIMEOUT. This means that it's
possible for the call to easily time out if there are ~11-12 users
on the guest.

This has been causing a lot of false negative failures in the
int-tests, so this updates the 'list_users' call to use the
AGENT_HIGH_TIMEOUT instead of the AGENT_LOW_TIMEOUT.

Closes-bug: 1356085
Change-Id: I589baa0e95febfb63538b79a082cc3dc55f66510
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Update 'list_users' call to use AGENT_HIGH_TIMEOUT

The list_users call in the guestagent takes about 0.4s - 0.5s per
user, and currently uses the AGENT_LOW_TIMEOUT. This means that it's
possible for the call to easily time out if there are ~11-12 users
on the guest.

This has been causing a lot of false negative failures in the
int-tests, so this updates the 'list_users' call to use the
AGENT_HIGH_TIMEOUT instead of the AGENT_LOW_TIMEOUT.

Closes-bug: 1356085
Change-Id: I589baa0e95febfb63538b79a082cc3dc55f66510

commit_message:
fix to handle object-expiration headers in one method

There was some duplication of code in both POST and PUT
methods to handle object-expiration headers.
A method was created to remove this duplication,
which should help with maintainability of code.

Change-Id: I85cc4a7b0d688760c97598d80b9e9a39288c5f34
Signed-off-by: Thiago da Silva <thiago@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Port the Datastore and DatastorePath objects

This patch ports the Datastore and DatastorePath objects which have
been approved in Nova and will be useful in Glance.
Finally, it adds the units module from oslo-incubator.

Change-Id: Ia519a83ed09fde74be376981f89284af20aa1dab

commit_message:
NSX: fix wording for configuration option

This patch clarifies that in order to use NSX distributed
routers, the replication_mode parameter should be set to
'service'. This is already its default value, so no further
change is needed beyond clarifying wording.

Change-Id: I446c428ecf8c0bf7f6947e69562d60a7fb4383ed
Closes-Bug: #1355502

commit_message:
Make plugin and l3plugin available as mixin's properties

This makes the code simpler and slightly more efficient.
This is a minor refactoring related to a race condition
observed when the agent is processing a router while its
interfaces are being removed.

Related-bug: #1355409

Change-Id: Ic0ce25aa6a977e28b1ab76081c74da4c46c2ca6b

commit_message:
Write javelin2 logs to stderr

We currently don't keep the oslo-logging based javelin2 logs in gate
runs, making it very hard to debug. Fix that by logging to stderr.

There is a bug in oslo that is causing stdout to not work, so use
stderr.

Specify config file via CLI (added in
I1e82e0a8e72117ba55048b2dab7aa9a8ba00c1cb)

Change-Id: Idbdac27392121e348ae0ab93477c98a904f8c001
Co-Authored-By: Sean Dague <sean@dague.net>

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-06-24 12:56:28.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Updated version requirement for websockify

This patch updated the websockify version from 0.5.1 to 0.6.0.
websockify is required by nova. The newer version of websockify
has native support for the python 'logging` module.

commit_message:
Updated version requirement for websockify

This patch updats the websockify version from 'websockify>=0.5.1,<0.6'
to 'websockify>=0.5.1,<0.7'.
websockify is required by nova. The newer version of websockify
has native support for the python 'logging` module.

blueprint: update-to-latest-websockify

Change-Id: I5030bd6d7f4c2326c9cf7c530f649e734322ab51

commit_message:
WIP: Translate input validation exceptions for V2.1 API

When input validation exceptions are raised for the V2.1 sometimes
the parameter names need to be translated from the V3 API version
(eg image_id) to the V2 API version (eg imageId). This patch intercepts
the validation exception and looks at the parameter mapping definition
to see if the name for the field which failed the input validation
needs to be translated to its V2.1 equivalent.

Partially implements blueprint v2-on-v3-api

Change-Id: I09f2270480493735cb637c17579c10e8fb57c276

commit_message:
WIP: Delay API validation failure message generation

Delays the generation of the API validation failure message
until exception handling in wsgi. This will allow for decorators
on API methods to perform some V3 to V2.1 translation on the
error messages. An example of a translation would be to translate
an incorrectly formatted image_id field to imageId for the V2.1
API.

Partially implements bp v2-on-v3-api

Change-Id: Ie29054602be52c351ed7b4a7b102d55ac170ff9f

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-04-07 06:03:12.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add logging capability to API input validation

Adds ability to set a config flag which results in the API input
validator only logging the error and allowing the request to proceed
rather than raise an exception.

This is being introduced to allow deployments to run against the
V2.1 API with the only input validation being a LOG message rather
than rejection. This can be used to better measure how many
applications are currently misusing the V2 API without causing
the applications to fail any more than they currently do.

Partially implements bp v2-on-v3-api

Change-Id: Ic2c010e69dd6c8c88feeb43f97ca4f9b82a0ead5

commit_message:
Add logging capability to API input validation

Adds ability to set a config flag which results in the API input
validator only logging the error and allowing the request to proceed
rather than raise an exception.

This is being introduced to allow deployments to run against the
V2.1 API with the only input validation being a LOG message rather
than rejection. This can be used to better measure how many
applications are currently misusing the V2 API without causing
the applications to fail any more than they currently do.

Partially implements bp v2-on-v3-api

Change-Id: Ic2c010e69dd6c8c88feeb43f97ca4f9b82a0ead5

commit_message:
Adds enable/disable config flag for V2.1

Adds a configuration flag to be able to enable/disable
the V2.1 emulation code in the V3 API.

Note that it currently defaults to True so we can test it in check queue
without any devstack changes. Before this is merged we would change it
so it defaults to False

DO NOT MERGE

Partially implements bp v2-on-v3-api

Change-Id: Ifd0fb583f9e831ce07314530a81f8a1bb4c8ad8b

commit_message:
Adds separate plugin namespace for V2.1 with V3 framework

Ads a separate plugin namespace in setup.cfg for the V2.1 API
in setup.cfg. This will allow the V2.1 API to have a different set
of plugins loaded in the same deployment than for V3. This is necessary
so that the V3 API is not forced to load plugins such as images
or volumes which the V2.1 needs to support for backwards compatibility
reasons

Partially implements blueprint v2-on-v3-api

[{'created': '2014-03-31 06:33:49.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Port images and image_metadata for V2.1 with V3 framework

Support emulation v2 extension output with v3 framework

Adds a v2.1 mode to the v3 extensions plugin. There is not a 1-1
mapping of extensions (or core) between the V2 and V3 API so a
manual lookup table is required to translate between V3 and what
should be presented as the V2 API

  extensions list. This will eventually be removed from the V3 API
  as well anyway

Partially implements blueprint v2-on-v3-api

commit_message:
Support emulation v2 extension output with v3 framework

Adds a v2.1 mode to the v3 extensions plugin. There is not a 1-1
mapping of extensions (or core) between the V2 and V3 API so a
manual lookup table is required to translate between V3 and what
should be presented as the V2 API

TODO: The table is incomplete - this is just a POC.
TODO: Core parts of the V3 API are still published into the V2
  extensions list. This will eventually be removed from the V3 API
  as well anyway

Partially implements blueprint v2-on-v3-api

Change-Id: I877394a1a54cd2540da1e87856493e5b8b3d6023

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-08-10 19:56:27.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add None as one of valid ipv6 attributes

According to https://www.dropbox.com/s/9bojvv9vywsz8sd/
IPv6%20Two%20Modes%20v3.0.pdf "Off" is valid IPv6
attribute state. Should be explicit way to send it as "Off".
Now it's impossible, you should miss it if you want it "Off".
Later it's checked and treated as "attribute not set" if None.

Change-Id: If4efb5f7d20ad901dd757e7efe05a08bc0039462
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2014-08-12 14:05:44.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add None as one of valid ipv6 attributes

commit_message:
Add None as one of valid ipv6 attributes

According to https://www.dropbox.com/s/9bojvv9vywsz8sd/
IPv6%20Two%20Modes%20v3.0.pdf
(or blueprint: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/102411/) 
flag "Off" is valid IPv6 attribute state. Should be 
explicit way to send it as "Off". Now it's impossible, 
you should miss it if you want it "Off".
Later it's checked and treated as "attribute not set" 
if None.

Change-Id: If4efb5f7d20ad901dd757e7efe05a08bc0039462

commit_message:
If no volume, don't delete volume in teardown

If exception is thrown in setupClass before volume is created,
tearDownClass needn't delete volume.

Change-Id: I91c7eff8ec147b0ce3a9ea3e6c8d906ba68412c2
Closes-Bug: 1350167

commit_message:
Remove cleanup code according to TODO comment

This patch removes the method _cleanup_ports as suggested by
the TODO comment. Review [1] has merged long time ago and
manually cleaning up ports should no longer be necessary.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/46563/

Change-Id: I7c8b547373b13133f8712b5bafab7bc072e0b610

subject: Enhance V3 extension class to use resources

[{'created': '2014-08-03 15:03:20.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/common/wsgi.py'], 'message': 'Enhance V3 extension class to use resources

RESTful APIs are resource-oriented, and the V3 extensions each
provide a RESTful API, but the current way that extensions map their
routes is based on URLs rather than resources. With this change, the
base V3 extensions class is enhanced to support a resource-oriented

', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Enhance V3 extension class to use resources

RESTful APIs are resource-oriented, and the V3 extensions each
provide a RESTful API, but the current way that extensions map their
routes is based on URLs rather than resources. With this change, the
base V3 extensions class is enhanced to support a resource-oriented
way to map paths to controllers and methods.

bp json-home

Change-Id: Ic82fc9d03b0073a8a1fcec5d03529c84e22f4d69

[{'created': '2014-08-08 17:30:35.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/tests/agentbase.py', 'ceilometer/agent.py'], 'message': 'Avoid duplication of discovery for multi-sink sources

Perviously, where a single source has a pluggable discovery
extension loaded and is associated with multiple sinks, the
discovered resources were duplicated for each sink.

Now, we ensure that duplicate discovery extensions are
excluded.

Closes-Bug: #1354536
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Avoid duplication of discovery for multi-sink sources

Perviously, where a single source has a pluggable discovery
extension loaded and is associated with multiple sinks, the
discovered resources were duplicated for each sink.

Now, we ensure that duplicate discovery extensions are
excluded.

Change-Id: Icffcc65f2be2baef7730b31773b39ffdda0454a7
Closes-Bug: #1354536

Hello world sample enhancement

Since we update the template incrementally during an update, after a failed
update we cannot determine what the last used properties of a resource were
just from the template (since e.g. the parameter values may have changed).
Use the property data stored in the database instead to determine whether a

Implements: partial-blueprint update-failure-recovery
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Diff against stored properties during update

Since we update the template incrementally during an update, after a failed
update we cannot determine what the last used properties of a resource were
just from the template (since e.g. the parameter values may have changed).
Use the property data stored in the database instead to determine whether a
resource needs to be updated.

Change-Id: I41f191265186fc3bcec1670403fd16a80c509740
Implements: partial-blueprint update-failure-recovery

commit_message:
Avoid naming time type module the same as a builtin

In order to avoid naming conflicts which can easily
occur if we name our time module as a python builtin
just pick a name that doesn't conflict (it still
retains the same meaning).

Change-Id: Ia19f3776689d2b1f31f7cbfaa15e53f99a3ee900

commit_message:
Remove need to do special exception catching in parse_uri

The upstream oslo incubator code was fixed to not throw a
index error when parts of the uri are missing, so we can
remove our modification that handles these errors and just
rely on the fixed version.

Change-Id: I01c6a647858ca45aeb4685a68cb3e28b575e1e05

commit_message:
Fix rebuild with cells

When rebuild_instances switched to a compute task it broke
cells since the cast was dropped as it didn't match.

This change moves the rebuild_instances to conductor and
also adds some unit tests checks on the compute
task integration point.

Change-Id: Ic1c575fbca72f1cd34b1dbc6f82023e5b2b392e2
Closes-Bug: 1348642

commit_message:
Makes versions API output deterministic

Makes the order of available versions that the API version
information is returned to clients deterministic. This is
necessary to ensure that with PYTHONHASHSEED to fixed to 0 the
unittests will consistently pass.

Change-Id: I5b7f6b7f061424adc2263c485562e72c7cc29255
Partial-Bug: #1350287

commit_message:
Allow tests to run outside tox

When using a test runner outside of tox (for example
using py.test directly against test files, one of several
ways to enable faster and more specific testing)
oslo.messaging.conffixture is not imported and text/base fails
to compile.

This change gets things working and otherwise has no impact.

Change-Id: Ibac6ae0a73aa55522b248a26b9a4b82455f8fce6

commit_message:
Use adapter from keystoneclient

SessionClient is mostly common code that wasn't yet released in
keystoneclient. Now that 0.10 is released we should use the adapter from
there as much as possible.

Change-Id: Ief6cd7e752fd8c9e9157364f99e270da7faff074

commit_message:
libvirt: Removed unused `disk_images` parameter

`disk_images` isn't used in `_create_image` so we can remove it and simplify
the code a bit.

Change-Id: Ida26135d7d1ffb3f3ae77e560ce246f03fd76ef5

commit_message:
ssl-ca: Allow CA certificate to be specified

Allow a CA certificate to be specified, and automatically add it to
the default system CA bundle via a new "ssl-ca" DIB element.

This is required for sites which use their own Certificate Authority.

This DIB element is safe to include on all images, regardless of
whether or not it is activated with a valid CA certificate.

Based on SSL PKI spec:
  I32473fe797a4c1e28d14c3b82c8892c7c59a4e55

Depends on t-h-t update for ssl.ca_certificate property via Heat:
  Ibacd7c98980520e11c0df89632013f2ba2dbe370

Change-Id: I3441b4b688aacb2bb8d8326ee72f87974dd554ff

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-02-21 10:06:10.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Fix order of arguments in assertEqual

Some tests used incorrect order assertEqual(observed, expected).

The correct order expected by testtools is...

    def assertEqual(self, expected, observed, message=''):
        """Assert that 'expected' is equal to 'observed'.

        :param expected: The expected value.
        :param observed: The observed value.
        :param message: An optional message to include in the error.
        """

The string length of the sum of the results of repr(expected) and
repr(observed) is greater than 70, then, MismatchError message is
changed, as below.

  Ex.:
        raise mismatch_error
    MismatchError: !=:
    reference = '_123456789_123456789_bar'
    actual    = '_123456789_123456789_123456789_123456789_123456789'

I think the case of Cinder, where correction is immense. Please also
consider the cost of the review itself in the future.

Change-Id: Idbe5368ba558b4cf8d2ed99af255f94d48986c33
Partial-Bug: #1259292

commit_message:
Fix order of arguments in assertEqual

Some tests used incorrect order assertEqual(observed, expected).

The correct order expected by testtools is...

    def assertEqual(self, expected, observed, message=''):
        """Assert that 'expected' is equal to 'observed'.

        :param expected: The expected value.
        :param observed: The observed value.
        :param message: An optional message to include in the error.
        """

The string length of the sum of the results of repr(expected) and
repr(observed) is greater than 70, then, MismatchError message is
changed, as below.

  Ex.:
        raise mismatch_error
    MismatchError: !=:
    reference = '_123456789_123456789_bar'
    actual    = '_123456789_123456789_123456789_123456789_123456789'

I think the case of Cinder, where correction is immense. Please also
consider the cost of the review itself in the future.

Change-Id: Idbe5368ba558b4cf8d2ed99af255f94d48986c33
Partial-Bug: #1259292

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-03-01 09:23:35.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Replace HTTPSConnection in zadara driver

Replace HTTPSConnection in zadara driver with Requests.

SSL Verification is from now on enabled by default.

This changes the default behaviour and is the primary intention of this
change: verify SSL certificates.

This might break existing configuration/setups where the SSL certificate
used by the SAN would not pass the verification.

Old behaviour can be force by using `san_ssl_insecure=True`.

SecurityImpact
DocImpact
Partial-Bug: 1188189

commit_message:
Replace HTTPSConnection in zadara with Requests

SSL Verification is from now on enabled by default.

This changes the default behaviour and is the primary intention of this
change: verify SSL certificates.

This might break existing configuration/setups where the SSL certificate
used by the SAN would not pass the verification.

Old behaviour can be forced by using `san_ssl_insecure=True`.

SecurityImpact
DocImpact
Partial-Bug: 1188189

Change-Id: I4799c2c5376fb54e5ebbdc4f9b6a1c526e7b8a8b

We need to add support for postgresql.

The deadlock exception thrown from postgresql is TransactionRollbackError,
it's not the same with "OperationalError" thrown from mysql,
and isn't included in sqlalchemy. So, the base exception need to be
catched.

Closes-Bug: #1331942
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Add _wrap_db_error support for postgresql

The original "_wrap_db_error" function is only available for mysql.
We need to add support for postgresql.

The deadlock exception thrown from postgresql is TransactionRollbackError,
it's not the same with "OperationalError" thrown from mysql,
and isn't included in sqlalchemy. So, the base exception need to be
catched.

Sync postgresql deadlock bug from oslo.db,
it's submit SHA-1: 3a6a5b01a72e0e20787f3d6a47f6f0c0262dbbeb

Change-Id: I17ddc82586db317d4ce9ac87c803a3667872bcac
Closes-Bug: #1331942

commit_message:
Fixes cinder quota-show information with wrong tenant-id

quota-show displays the default information eventhough specified
tenant-id does not exists:

  cinder quota-show wrong_tenant_id

The fix has been applied so that quota-show with wrong tenant-id will
display an error with "TenantID not found"

Change-Id: I9e32ed32f761a59746222aa2a1cafb05802847b7
Closes-Bug: #1307475

[{'created': '2014-04-24 10:04:08.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Help volume and snapshot which status is creating

Service of volume goes down after the status of
the volume is turned 'creating', volume to remain with
the status of the 'creating'.

Status of the volume is still 'creating' even if
volume service is restarted, it is impossible for user
to remove it without force-delete.

With this patch, in order to keep consistence with Nova,
volume state 'creating' should be shifted to the error properly.

commit_message:
Change volume and snapshot stuck creating to error

Service of volume goes down after the status of
the volume is turned 'creating', volume to remain with
the status of the 'creating'.

Status of the volume is still 'creating' even if
volume service is restarted, it is impossible for user
to remove it without force-delete.

With this patch, in order to keep consistence with Nova,
volume state 'creating' should be shifted to the error properly.

Change-Id: I777ee0c809415077106ff2e6afe5a2c88670a773
Closes-Bug: #1310526

commit_message:
Show volume dependent snap-id list while deleting

I have added change which display snapshot list in error
message to the volume being deleted also I have validated
the data being returned.

Closes-Bug: #1276101
Change-Id: I42f6a50669463146e46e5b0951d1e91b9a4d24bc

commit_message:
Disable volume copy bandwidth limit for specified disks

This patch adds a new config option "volume_copy_no_limit_devices" to
disable volume copy bandwidth limit for specified disks here. This is
useful to avoid the throttling for local disks of the cinder volume
node which doesn't affect volume access performance of instances.

Change-Id: I985765d5305247eaf6065f206e41e7f6c941a5c5
Closes-Bug: 1348276
DocImpact: new config option 'volume_copy_no_limit_devices'

commit_message:
Add ProphetStor Federator Volume Driver for cinder

ProphetStor Federator is a software-defined storage platform that
supports multiple storage back-ends to enhance Cinder
functionalities. Federator abstracts, pools, and automatically
provisions the appropriate type of storage based on the selected
Cinder volume-type.

Change-Id: If411e49b0ffd8da3f9ced9936c8750d59418ea80
Implements: blueprint prophetstor-federator-driver
cinder-cert-result: http://download.prophetstor.com/cinder-cert-results/tmp.vOAdhQdDsy

[{'created': '2014-06-25 03:26:02.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Harden tgtadm chap authentication

When using LVMISCSIDriver and iscsi_helper tgtadm,
it should support chap unidirectional authentication
because target configuration file and db.volume has
record chap user and chap passwd.
By testing, tgtadm iscsi chap does not work.

We should fix the bug by setting user/passwd and binding it
to relative tid before leaving leaving the function
TgtAdm:create_iscsi_target, so as to harden chap authentication.

Change-Id: I1cd56aab4f58c27010a1a2eb77d56673b9d829b3

commit_message:
Harden tgtadm chap authentication

When using LVMISCSIDriver and iscsi_helper tgtadm,
it should support chap unidirectional authentication
because target configuration file and db.volume has
record chap user and chap passwd.
By testing, tgtadm iscsi chap does not work.

We should fix the bug by setting user/passwd and binding it
to relative tid before leaving leaving the function
TgtAdm:create_iscsi_target, so as to harden chap authentication.

Change-Id: I1cd56aab4f58c27010a1a2eb77d56673b9d829b3
Closes-Bug: #1329214
